Agoniser.flavor: An agoniser is an extremely sophisticated weapon that drives a victim’s sensorium haywire, causing excruciatingly severe pain as nerves burn out from overload. Though agonisers come in a variety of forms, the most common are toxin-soaked whips.
Agoniser.name: Agoniser

Anointed Halberd.flavor: Anointed Halberds are heavy Power Halberds that are wielded by the Adepta Sororitas' Celestian Sacresants. When properly wielded from behind the Ceslestians’ impenetrable Sacresant Shields, they are deadly in battle.
Anointed Halberd.name: Anointed Halberd

Anguish of the Unredeemed.flavor: The Sisters Repentia encased inside the Mortifier penitent engines desire two things: absolution through combat and their own death. Yet their pain is so great that they fail to realise when they are dying, continuing to strike at their enemy, striving for redemption even as they die having achieved it.
Anguish of the Unredeemed.name: Anguish of the Unredeemed

Aquila Macro-Cannon.flavor: The munitions silo allows the Aquila macro-cannon to fire special quake shells, each of which measures several feet in length and has a powerful charge that causes it to reach hyper-sonic velocity when it is fired.
Aquila Macro-Cannon.name: Aquila Macro-Cannon

Arc Claw.flavor: The coruscating power of a Breacher’s arc weaponry is undeniable in combat, where scintillating parabolas of electricity burn through foes. Yet it was designed for destroying vehicles and only against them is its true power revealed, banishing their machine spirits in an instant.
Arc Claw.name: Arc Claw

Arco-Flail.flavor: An Arco-flagellant’s arms are often replaced with bionic whips, blades or flails.
Arco-Flail.name: Arco-Flail

Archite Glaive.flavor: These power glaives are exquisitely crafted pole-arms employed to lethal effect by Succubi in both the gladiatorial arenas of Commorragh and the battlefields of realspace. They can be wielded with both hands, to bisect a foe with ease, or used in combination with another weapon to cut through a host of victims.
Archite Glaive.name: Archite Glaive

Assault Cannon.flavor: These robust weapons are automated, self-loading firearms that fire bursts of high-velocity, caseless shot. Auto-weapons come in a variety of forms, from the common autopistol to heavy support weapons like the punisher gatling cannon.
Assault Cannon.name: Assault Cannon

Autogun.flavor: These robust weapons are automated, self-loading firearms that fire bursts of high-velocity, caseless shot. Auto-weapons come in a variety of forms, from the common autopistol to heavy support weapons like the punisher gatling cannon.
Autogun.name: Autogun

Attack Squig.description: Adds an additional weapon to the Warboss. Damage scales with ability rank.
Attack Squig.flavor: An attack squig is a voracious predator with a huge snapping gob.
Attack Squig.name: Attack Squig

Autocannon.flavor: These robust weapons are automated, self-loading firearms that fire bursts of high-velocity, caseless shot. Auto-weapons come in a variety of forms, from the common autopistol to heavy support weapons like the punisher gatling cannon.
Autocannon.name: Autocannon

Autopistol.flavor: These robust weapons are automated, self-loading firearms that fire bursts of high-velocity, caseless shot. Auto-weapons come in a variety of forms, from the common autopistol to heavy support weapons like the punisher gatling cannon.
Autopistol.name: Autopistol

Avenger Bolt Cannon.flavor: With six cyclic barrels, the avenger bolt cannon can fire large calibre shells at a prodigious rate. These high velocity shots mow down enemy infantry or rip easily through light armour. Well-placed shots can tear through even thicker plating, blasting apart the heaviest armoured infantry or battle tanks. When firing at maximum rate, the avenger stitches deadly patterns of death across the enemy’s front lines while making a whirring hiss as the barrels spin faster than the eye can follow.
Avenger Bolt Cannon.name: Avenger Bolt Cannon

Avenger Gatling Cannon.flavor: With six cyclic barrels, the avenger gatling cannon can fire large calibre shells at a prodigious rate. These high velocity shots mow down enemy infantry or rip easily through light armour. Well-placed shots can tear through even thicker plating, blasting apart the heaviest armoured infantry or battle tanks. When firing at maximum rate, the avenger stitches deadly patterns of death across the enemy’s front lines while making a whirring hiss as the barrels spin faster than the eye can follow.
Avenger Gatling Cannon.name: Avenger Gatling Cannon

Baleflamer.flavor: Flamers are short-ranged weapons that spew out highly volatile clouds of liquid chemicals that ignite on contact with air. They are primarily used to scour the enemy from defended positions, as walls are of no defence against blasts of superheated vapour.
Baleflamer.name: Baleflamer

Baneblade Cannon.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.
Baneblade Cannon.name: Baneblade Cannon

Barbed Strangler.flavor: These weapons fire seed pods that grow to maturity in seconds, spreading out hooked tendrils in all directions.
Barbed Strangler.name: Barbed Strangler

Battle Cannon.flavor: The turret-mounted battle cannon is the most common battle tank armament in the 41st Millennium. The heavy, explosive rounds of a battle cannon are capable of devastating infantry regiments and annihilating enemy tanks with equal ease.
Battle Cannon.name: Battle Cannon

Big Shoota.flavor: Shootas are noisy, large-calibre machine guns. They vary wildly in size and design, from those carried by foot-slogging Boyz to long barrelled supa-shootas that are mounted on aircraft. Regardless of their particular design, all shootas are both deafening and deadly.
Big Shoota.name: Big Shoota

Bigbomm.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.
Bigbomm.name: Bigbomm

Bio-Electric Pulse.flavor: As a Trygon moves, it generates a potent bio-static field that discharges with lethal effect when the Trygon sights prey. Trygon Primes have curved spines sprouting from their bodies which contain and amplify this energy.
Bio-Electric Pulse.name: Bio-Electric Pulse

Bio-Plasma.flavor: Some Carnifexes can generate a roaring ball of bio-plasma within their bodies and vomit forth the resultant energy as an incandescent gobbet of fire.
Bio-Plasma.name: Bio-Plasma

Bio-Plasmic Cannon.flavor: This giant weapon can channel bio-plasma through a series of different ventricles to ensure the destruction of its prey, unleashing a vast ball of roaring energy through its central chamber, or firing several focussed streams of death through its surrounding barrels.
Bio-Plasmic Cannon.name: Bio-Plasmic Cannon

Blaster.flavor: Darklight works by reacting catastrophically with its target, producing a blast that can bore a massive hole in a vehicle regardless of armour, or vaporise a foot soldier in an instant. Even to perceive a beam of darklight without the correct protection leaves permanent slash-scars upon the retina.
Blaster.name: Blaster

Blast Pistol.flavor: Darklight works by reacting catastrophically with its target, producing a blast that can bore a massive hole in a vehicle regardless of armour, or vaporise a foot soldier in an instant. Even to perceive a beam of darklight without the correct protection leaves permanent slash-scars upon the retina.
Blast Pistol.name: Blast Pistol

Blinding Venom.flavor: Some Tyranids spit caustic venom at their prey's eyes.
Blinding Venom.name: Blinding Venom

Boneswords.flavor: Boneswords are living monomolecular blades that can drain the life-force of their victims.
Boneswords.name: Boneswords

Bolt Pistol.flavor: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.
Bolt Pistol.name: Bolt Pistol

Boltgun.flavor: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.
Boltgun.name: Boltgun

Bolt Rifle.flavor: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.
Bolt Rifle.name: Bolt Rifle

Bombast Field Gun.flavor: A mainstay of the Astra Militarum, the Bombast Field Gun is a smaller-scale artillery weapon used exclusively in Field Ordnance Batteries. Its main advantage over other standardised battery armaments is its arcing trajectory, allowing it to be fired indirectly.
Bombast Field Gun.name: Bombast Field Gun

Bone Mace.flavor: The tails of some Tyranids are deadly weapons, from bony protrusions dense enough to cave in the side of a tank to stingers containing enough poison to kill whole regiments.
Bone Mace.name: Bone Mace

Breath of Chaos.flavor: The psyker takes a deep breath, sucking in the negative energies of the battlefield and then exhaling them in a great mutagenic cloud that leaves its victims' bodies running like wax.
Breath of Chaos.name: Breath of Chaos

Bright Lance.flavor: Aeldari lasers use psychically grown crystals to refine the already intense bursts to their optimum potency. Many Aeldari consider the laser weapon the most elegant of all, exulting in the fact that their technological mastery extends even to light itself.
Bright Lance.name: Bright Lance

Burna Bomb.flavor: A burna bomb is a large metal canister with an internal fuse. They are filled to the gunwales with sloshing promethium and squig-oil, and detonate on impact to spread flaming death across a wide area.
Burna Bomb.name: Burna Bomb

Burna.flavor: Burnas are long-necked cutting torches that can focus their fiery emissions into a concentrated, metal-slicing jet or a billowing cloud of white-hot flame.
Burna.name: Burna

Burst Cannon.flavor: Burst weaponry finds use across the T'au military, primarily mounted on battlesuits and vehicles. Utilising a similar plasma induction technology found in T'au pulse technology, burst cannons are multibarrelled weapons able to sustain high rates of fire.
Burst Cannon.name: Burst Cannon

Bursta Kannon.flavor: Also known as Titan-killers, destroyer weapons deliver horrifying amounts of damage.
Bursta Kannon.name: Bursta Kannon

Castigator Battle Cannon (Sanctified She.flavor: Though the Castigator Battle Cannon is of a normal style, the shells it fires are of the Ministorum’s own designs. Even its ‘normal’ shells are thoroughly blessed, producing more reliable, stronger blasts that penetrate deeper than the average Leman Russ battle cannon.
Castigator Battle Cannon (Sanctified She.name: Castigator Battle Cannon (Sanctified Shell)

Castigator Battle Cannon (Pyre Shell).flavor: Though the Castigator Battle Cannon is of a normal style, the shells it fires are of the Ministorum’s own designs. Pyre shells are unlike anything deployed by the Astra Militarum, creating a massive firestorm where they strike that rips through cover with ease.
Castigator Battle Cannon (Pyre Shell).name: Castigator Battle Cannon (Pyre Shell)

Castigator Gatling Cannon.flavor: In an universe full of bizarre and impossible technologies, the Castigator is a welcome touch of simplicity. A tried-and-tested design, its rotary cannon deploys an unparalleled hail of bullets devastating any poorly armoured opponent in front of the Rogal Dorn.
Castigator Gatling Cannon.name: Castigator Gatling Cannon

Cerastus Shock Lance (Melee).flavor: A crackling, rippling stick of plasteel and adamantium, the length of a Knight or a Super-heavy Tank, with a wickedly sharp end. Most effective when the Knight-Lancer carrying it is charging at full speed, bracing for the impact and the explosive, rending aftermath.
Cerastus Shock Lance (Melee).name: Cerastus Shock Lance (Melee)

Cerastus Shock Lance (Ranged).flavor: A crackling, rippling stick of plasteel and adamantium, the length of a Knight or a Super-heavy Tank, with a wickedly sharp end. Most effective when the Knight-Lancer carrying it is charging at full speed, bracing for the impact and the explosive, rending aftermath.
Cerastus Shock Lance (Ranged).name: Cerastus Shock Lance (Ranged)

Chain-Flails.flavor: Chain-flails consist of lengths of barbed chain wound tight under gravitic pressure. As a Talos glides into battle, these chains are loosed, hurtling from their housings to lash around wildly. As their barbs find purchase in flesh, the chains’ grav-winches re-engage, reeling in at lightning speed to snap bones and tear bodies asunder.
Chain-Flails.name: Chain-Flails

Chainsword.flavor: A chainsword is a high-powered chainsaw fitted with hilt, pommel and guard to make it less unwieldy. It is a common weapon across the Imperium, with a quite horrifying reputation for the damage it can inflict on unarmoured flesh.
Chainsword.name: Chainsword

Choppa.flavor: Orks use a variety of bladed weapons and chain-blades. The largest hand-held choppas can bisect most foes in a single swing, whilst those mounted on Stompas can slice a Titan in two.
Choppa.name: Choppa

Crucible of Malediction.flavor: Haemonculi refer to this extraordinary weapon as ‘the kin-gift’, for it is especially dangerous to their psychically attuned craftworld cousins. Each crucible contains the essence of psykers tortured to death. When released, their spirits hurtle across the battlefield, shrieking in a cacophony that drives nearby enemies insane.
Crucible of Malediction.name: Crucible of Malediction

Crushing Claws.flavor: The obscene strength of these claws allows them to smash any foe.
Crushing Claws.name: Crushing Claws

Clawed Limbs.flavor: Warriors across the galaxy employ a wide variety of close-quarter weapons. Blood-flecked chainswords and crude knives take their places alongside powered weapons of all kinds: swords, axes, hammers and many more. All such weapons are designed to bring quick and painful death to the foe, for every moment's delay brings defeat a step closer.
Clawed Limbs.name: Clawed Limbs

Cleansing Flame.flavor: The psyker harnesses the very fire in his soul, creating a wall of white-hot psychic flame that blasts forth and purges his foes from the battlefield.
Cleansing Flame.name: Cleansing Flame

Close Combat Weapon.flavor: Warriors across the galaxy employ a wide variety of close-quarter weapons. Blood-flecked chainswords and crude knives take their places alongside powered weapons of all kinds: swords, axes, hammers and many more. All such weapons are designed to bring quick and painful death to the foe, for every moment's delay brings defeat a step closer.
Close Combat Weapon.name: Close Combat Weapon

Cluster Mines.flavor: While operating behind enemy lines, Scout Bikers carry cluster mines—explosive devices crammed with tiny anti-personnel bomblets and triggered by tripwires or pressure sensors.
Cluster Mines.name: Cluster Mines

Cluster Rocket System.flavor: These massive rocket pods are programmed to fire dozens of Drone-assisted warheads in optimised saturation patterns, maintaining a rate and density of fire sufficient to destroy entire mobs of Orks or swarms of Tyranids weapon-beasts. Explosions carpet the target zone, hurling bodies into the air and atomising screaming foes by the score.
Cluster Rocket System.name: Cluster Rocket System

Cognis Heavy Stubber.flavor: Cognis weaponry, though superficially similar to that used by the rest of the Imperium, has one vital difference – a cognis weapon’s machine spirit has been permanently awakened by the rites of the Machine God. When the wielder is unable to give his full concentration, the warlike spirit of the gun will take over.
Cognis Heavy Stubber.name: Cognis Heavy Stubber

Combi-Bolter.flavor: Essentially a twin-linked boltgun, the combi-bolter emerged from the Horus Heresy as the most tactically flexible weapon available to Space Marine Terminators. Whilst the Space Marines loyal to the Emperor developed the weapon into the storm bolter, the older combi-bolters are still abundant in the armies of the Traitor Legions.
Combi-Bolter.name: Combi-Bolter

Combi-Plasma.flavor: Many races use combi-weapons, from the taped-together creations of Ork Mekboyz to Imperial relic weapons, specially modified by skilled artisans millennia ago. Most of these creations feature a bolter in combination with another weapon, to increase the combination’s flexibility and power at the cost of its ease of handling.
Combi-Plasma.name: Combi-Plasma

Condemnor Boltgun's Silver Stake.flavor: The condemnor boltgun is a highly specialised combi-weapon used almost exclusively by the operatives of the Ordo Hereticus and Adepta Sororitas. Combining a boltgun with a single-shot crossbow armature, these archaic-seeming weapons fire a silver stake engraved with sigils of disruption that destabilise a psyker’s connection with the Warp.
Condemnor Boltgun's Silver Stake.name: Condemnor Boltgun's Silver Stake

Control Stave.flavor: Serving as a staff of office, control mechanism and weapon, a Control Stave is carried only by Skitarii Marshals. Despite its multidinous roles, it functions well at all of them—a brutal close combat weapon, that also enables the Marshal to control his Skitarii closely through Control Edicts and Aggression Overrides.
Control Stave.name: Control Stave

Crozius Arcanum.flavor: The crozius arcanum is both a Chaplain's rod of office and his weapon of righteous judgement. Each one is an ancient relic, with the legends of its bearers captured in etched script about its haft.
Crozius Arcanum.name: Crozius Arcanum

Cyclic Ion Raker (Overcharged).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Cyclic Ion Raker (Overcharged).name: Cyclic Ion Raker (Overcharged)

Cyclic Ion Raker (Standard).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Cyclic Ion Raker (Standard).name: Cyclic Ion Raker (Standard)

D-Cannon.flavor: The most dangerous of all Aeldari weapons enable their user to open a portal to the Warp. Often called D-weapons, these technological terrors collapse an area of the material universe. Whether the rift is localised or dispersed, the result is invariably fatal for those nearby.
D-Cannon.name: D-Cannon

Daedalus Missile Launcher.flavor: The Icarus arrays used by the Adeptus Mechanicus fill the sky with inescapable death. Comprising a twin Icarus autocannon with skyscryer lenses, a gatling rocket launcher that fires whole salvoes of flak and an armour-piercing missile launcher, its combined firepower can shred an entire squadron of enemy fighters.
Daedalus Missile Launcher.name: Daedalus Missile Launcher

Dark Lance.flavor: Darklight works by reacting catastrophically with its target, producing a blast that can bore a massive hole in a vehicle regardless of armour, or vaporise a foot soldier in an instant. Even to perceive a beam of darklight without the correct protection leaves permanent slash-scars upon the retina.
Dark Lance.name: Dark Lance

Dataspike.flavor: The dataspikes favoured by the agents of the Adeptus Mechanicus can stab into the cortex of enemy machines and steal their secrets within a couple of heartbeats.
Dataspike.name: Dataspike

Death Ray.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.
Death Ray.name: Death Ray

Deathshriek.flavor: At the point of an Umbra’s death, all those around it receive a vision—of the long ago creature that was torn asunder and cast into the Warp, whilst a voice, horrifying and alluring, whispers a curse… “LINGER…”
Deathshriek.name: Deathshriek

Deathspitter.flavor: This multi-creature symbiote fires maggot-like organisms with corrosive innards. A spider-jawed set of fangs drags an organism from the weapon's brooding chamber and strips off its shell, before the deathspitter reacts to the caustic flesh with a spasm, firing the maggot to explode in a shower of caustic slime against its target.
Deathspitter.name: Deathspitter

Defensive Heavy Stubber.flavor: These are low-tech solutions to ranged warfare on high-tech battlefields. Encompassing such weapons as shotguns, stub guns and heavy stubbers (sometimes called sluggers), the common bond between all of these weapons is that they are, without exception, cumbersome, noisy and fairly primitive firearms. Often employed by gangers, law enforcement officers and even civilians across the Imperium, these weapons make a formidable din when fired, and are easy to maintain.
Defensive Heavy Stubber.name: Defensive Heavy Stubber

Deffstorm Mega-Shoota.flavor: Shootas are noisy, large-calibre machine guns. They vary wildly in size and design, from those carried by foot-slogging Boyz to long barrelled supa-shootas that are mounted on aircraft. Regardless of their particular design, all shootas are both deafening and deadly.
Deffstorm Mega-Shoota.name: Deffstorm Mega-Shoota

Demolisher Cannon.flavor: Short ranged but deadly, the demolisher siege cannon trades reach for power. Each demolisher shell is at least three times the size of a normal battle cannon round, its huge weight and high explosive core ensuring it will annihilate almost anything it hits.
Demolisher Cannon.name: Demolisher Cannon

Destroyer Blades.description: Can only target infantry or monstrous creatures.
Destroyer Blades.flavor: The hull of this vehicle has been modified with hideously sharp spikes, whirring blades and jagged spars.
Destroyer Blades.name: Destroyer Blades

Destroyer Missile.flavor: Each sleek destroyer missile incorporates an AI targeting processor far more advanced than anything used in seeker missiles. Drawing on extensive real-time targeting data, the destroyer missile identifies its target's primary weak spot. It then uses self-guiding micro rockets to adjust trajectory and ensure a direct hit upon that location, tearing its victim apart in a spectacular explosion.
Destroyer Missile.name: Destroyer Missile

Destructor.flavor: Caging a portion of his psychic might, the Spiritseer sends waves of energy forth to destroy his enemies in a burst of azure flame--or, if the need arises, heal the wounds of his allies.
Destructor.name: Destructor

Devourer.flavor: These weapons fling worm-like parasites that burrow into their victim's flesh and eat their way through its nervous system to the brain. The devourers wielded by larger Tyranids teem with hives of brainleech worms, a more aggressive and voracious devourer worm.
Devourer.name: Devourer

Dialogus Staff.flavor: The Dialogus Staff is the symbol of office of the Orders Dialogus which in combat can also double as a combat weapon.
Dialogus Staff.name: Dialogus Staff

Disintegrator Cannon.flavor: The disintegrator cannon fires particles of unstable matter harnessed from a stolen sun, each shot capable of atomising the most heavily armoured warrior. Far more sophisticated than conventional plasma-based firearms, it maintains a high rate of fire and always remains cool to the touch despite the ravening energies housed within.
Disintegrator Cannon.name: Disintegrator Cannon

Doomsday Cannon (High Power).flavor: Even fired at low power, the doomsday cannon is a fearsome weapon; when firing at full effect, nothing less than a Titan's void shields can offer hope of protection.
Doomsday Cannon (High Power).name: Doomsday Cannon (High Power)

Doomsday Cannon (Low Power).flavor: Even fired at low power, the doomsday cannon is a fearsome weapon; when firing at full effect, nothing less than a Titan's void shields can offer hope of protection.
Doomsday Cannon (Low Power).name: Doomsday Cannon (Low Power)

Desiccator Larvae.flavor: Certain Tyranids have thoracic cavities that play host to swarms of parasites—some of these minute creatures drain their victims' vital fluids, others emit an electrical charge which plays havoc with enemy vehicles, and others still nestle amongst the foe's armour before exploding in a horrific fashion.
Desiccator Larvae.name: Desiccator Larvae

Disruptor Missile Launcher.flavor: Like its Ferrumite Cannon main armament, the Skorpius Disintegrator’s prow-mounted Disruptor Missiles are most effective against tougher targets with medium armour.
Disruptor Missile Launcher.name: Disruptor Missile Launcher

Drool Cannon.flavor: Drool cannons fire gobbets of caustic digestive juice over their victims.
Drool Cannon.name: Drool Cannon

EMP Grenade.flavor: EMP grenades release electromagnetic pulses that damage vehicles.
EMP Grenade.name: EMP Grenade

Earthshaker Cannon.flavor: The distinctive, looming barrel of the earthshaker cannon is a sight capable of striking fear into the Imperium's many foes. These long-necked artillery guns have an impressive range and can maintain a fearsome rate of fire, lobbing shell after shell into foes and reducing them to blasted ruin.
Earthshaker Cannon.name: Earthshaker Cannon

Eldritch Storm.flavor: The Farseer summons a swirling corona of energy that assails the foe with bolts of lightning and psychic shock waves. Entire platoons are devastated beneath the onslaught of the roiling tempest as the Farseer channels more and more power into his storm of destruction.
Eldritch Storm.name: Eldritch Storm

Electroleech Stave.flavor: The powerful capacitors built into the length of each electroleech stave allow them to drink every iota of electric force from those they strike – be they living foeman or blasphemous machine.
Electroleech Stave.name: Electroleech Stave

Eviscerating Claws.flavor: Warriors across the galaxy employ a wide variety of close-quarter weapons. Blood-flecked chainswords and crude knives take their places alongside powered weapons of all kinds: swords, axes, hammers and many more. All such weapons are designed to bring quick and painful death to the foe, for every moment's delay brings defeat a step closer.
Eviscerating Claws.name: Eviscerating Claws

Eviscerator.flavor: A chainsword is a high-powered chainsaw fitted with hilt, pommel and guard to make it less unwieldy. It is a common weapon across the Imperium, with a quite horrifying reputation for the damage it can inflict on unarmoured flesh.
Eviscerator.name: Eviscerator

Excruciator Cannon.flavor: These robust weapons are automated, self-loading firearms that fire bursts of high-velocity, caseless shot. Auto-weapons come in a variety of forms, from the common autopistol to heavy support weapons like the punisher gatling cannon.
Excruciator Cannon.name: Excruciator Cannon

Exorcist Missile Launcher.flavor: The Exorcist missiles fired by these revered vehicles are capable of splitting open enemy battle tanks or destroying entire squads of heavy infantry in one punishing salvo, provided, of course, that the Exorcist’s temperamental machine spirit does not malfunction.
Exorcist Missile Launcher.name: Exorcist Missile Launcher

Ferrumite Cannon.flavor: A primitive and ancient weapon system, the Ferumite Cannon’s Servitor gunner has been hard-wired into the weapon for optimal performance against large targets. When its cannon fires, the solid-core shells arc across the battlefield, turning into molten spears on contact and flash-heating whatever they impale.
Ferrumite Cannon.name: Ferrumite Cannon

Flamer.flavor: Flamers are short-ranged weapons that spew out highly volatile clouds of liquid chemicals that ignite on contact with air. They are primarily used to scour the enemy from defended positions, as walls are of no defence against blasts of superheated vapour.
Flamer.name: Flamer

Flame Breath.flavor: A torrent of psychic flames pour forth from the psyker's eyes and mouth, engulfing the target.
Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath

Flamestorm Gauntlets.flavor: Flamestorm Gauntlets are close combat weapons mounted with short-ranged flamers that spew out highly volatile gouts of promethium and other chemicals. Aggressors use these as they wade into combat, before crushing any remaining foes with their twin power fists.
Flamestorm Gauntlets.name: Flamestorm Gauntlets

Flayer Claws.flavor: Flayed Ones replace their hands with an array of lethally sharp blades, claws and mechanical shears to better tear and shred their prey into ribbons of bloody flesh.
Flayer Claws.name: Flayer Claws

Flechette Blaster.flavor: The flechette blaster is lightweight but lethal, a favoured tool of the Sicarian Infiltrator. It fires hundreds of tiny darts, each of which bears a dormant cerebral cell awakened in the gun’s chamber. Where one dart hits home it emits a bioelectric pulse that attracts others, resulting in a series of impacts that burrow through bone.
Flechette Blaster.name: Flechette Blaster

Flechette Discharger.flavor: Powerful clusters of reactive charges are attached to the hulls of many T'au vehicles. If the enemy approaches, the clusters fire off vicious clouds of high velocity flechettes.
Flechette Discharger.name: Flechette Discharger

Fleshborer.flavor: The fleshborer is a compact brood nest for sharp-fanged borer beetles. When the weapon is fired, a frenzied borer beetle will hurtle itself forward with a single flick of its flea-like legs. The beetle then spends its remaining life energy in a few seconds, frantically boring through the armour, flesh and bone of the first thing in its path.
Fleshborer.name: Fleshborer

Flesh Hooks.flavor: Flesh hooks are attached to a Tyranid's ribcage by ropy tendrils and allow it to scale sheer surfaces or snare prey at close range.
Flesh Hooks.name: Flesh Hooks

Floating Death.flavor: Only the evolutionary villainy of the Hive Mind could turn a living creature into a floating ball of unstable acid, gas and brittle bone with the sole purpose of sowing massed death upon its demise.
Floating Death.name: Floating Death

Force Stave.flavor: Force weapons are potent psychic weapons used exclusively by trained psykers. By instilling a portion of his mental might into the weapon, a psyker can strike his foe with an incredible storm of power that ravages and overloads his enemy's nervous system, leaving him a mindless shell.
Force Stave.name: Force Stave

Frag Grenade.flavor: The lethal storm of shrapnel from these grenades drives opponents further under the cover for a few precious moments, allowing attackers more time to close in and, hopefully, get the first blow in against a disoriented foe.
Frag Grenade.name: Frag Grenade

Frag Missile Launcher.flavor: Missile launchers can fire a variety of different missiles, making them incredibly versatile weapons.
Frag Missile Launcher.name: Frag Missile Launcher

Fragstorm Grenade Launcher.flavor: A paired set of grenade launchers mounted on Primaris Aggressors or Redemptor Dreadnoughts. The only element that distinguishes these from launchers used by other Adeptus Astartes or even Astra Militarum forces is their ability to thoroughly saturate a target at range.
Fragstorm Grenade Launcher.name: Fragstorm Grenade Launcher

Frazzle.flavor: The Weirdboy sends out arcs of crackling psychic energy that ground themselves upon the enemy, reducing them to shrivelled husks before the eyes of their terrified comrades.
Frazzle.name: Frazzle

Fusion Blaster.flavor: Fusion weapons are anti-tank weapons that reduce reinforced armour to molten slag in the blink of an eye.
Fusion Blaster.name: Fusion Blaster

Fusion Gun.flavor: Fusion weapons are anti-tank weapons that reduce reinforced armour to molten slag in the blink of an eye.
Fusion Gun.name: Fusion Gun

Fusion Pistol.flavor: Fusion weapons are anti-tank weapons that reduce reinforced armour to molten slag in the blink of an eye.
Fusion Pistol.name: Fusion Pistol

Gamma Pistol.flavor: The gamma pistol is entrusted only to the truly blessed. The beam of ionizing radiation that leaps from its muzzle can reduce a man to a blackened shadow in a second, but this is a waste of its true strength – those able to tame its savage machine spirit can cut holes in an Aquila Strongpoint if necessary.
Gamma Pistol.name: Gamma Pistol

Gatling Rocket Launcher.flavor: The Icarus arrays used by the Adeptus Mechanicus fill the sky with inescapable death. Comprising a twin Icarus autocannon with skyscryer lenses, a gatling rocket launcher that fires whole salvoes of flak and an armour-piercing missile launcher, its combined firepower can shred an entire squadron of enemy fighters.
Gatling Rocket Launcher.name: Gatling Rocket Launcher

Gauss Annihilator.flavor: The Gauss Pylon draws energy from the Necron power matrix before discharging it through hardwired weapon systems, including a version of the gauss flux arc also mounted on Monoliths. More fearsome is the Pylon's Gauss annihilator—a tight-beam version of the particle whip which, combined with sophisticated guidance and target-lock systems, enable it to engage troops and incoming aircraft alike.
Gauss Annihilator.name: Gauss Annihilator

Gauss Cannon.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.
Gauss Cannon.name: Gauss Cannon

Gauss Flayer.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.
Gauss Flayer.name: Gauss Flayer

Gauss Flayer Array.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.
Gauss Flayer Array.name: Gauss Flayer Array

Gauss Flux Arc.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.
Gauss Flux Arc.name: Gauss Flux Arc

Ghost Axe.flavor: The rudimentary sentience within the spirit stone core of each ghost weapon, whether axe, glaive or sword, empowers the blade and guides its wielder’s blows toward the vital points of his foe.
Ghost Axe.name: Ghost Axe

Ghost Glaive.flavor: The rudimentary sentience within the spirit stone core of each ghost weapon, whether axe, glaive or sword, empowers the blade and guides its wielder’s blows toward the vital points of his foe.
Ghost Glaive.name: Ghost Glaive

Gorestorm Cannon.flavor: The gorestorm cannon is a simple but horribly effective weapon that sprays a high-pressure torrent of boiling blood across a wide area. Those not dissolved amid the horrific flood are drowned, or else cooked alive inside their armour.
Gorestorm Cannon.name: Gorestorm Cannon

Grasping Tongue.flavor: This creature's clawed tongue grasps its chosen prey before yanking it bodily into its maw.
Grasping Tongue.name: Grasping Tongue

Greater Cleaver of Khorne.flavor: Each of these vast, brazen blades weighs as much as a battle tank. Swung with psychotic fury by a Lord of Skulls, a great cleaver can shear the leg from a Titan with a single blow.
Greater Cleaver of Khorne.name: Greater Cleaver of Khorne

Grenadier Gauntlet.flavor: These simple gauntlets lob frag-bombs into the midst of the foe.
Grenadier Gauntlet.name: Grenadier Gauntlet

Hades Autocannon.flavor: The hades autocannon is the most frequently seen adorning the hideous Daemon Engines with which the Warpsmiths conquer the planets of the Imperium. Hades autocannons have six barrels and can sustain such a massive rate of fire that they are capable of tearing apart massed infantry, and even well-armoured targets, with each thunderous volley of shells.
Hades Autocannon.name: Hades Autocannon

Hades Gatling Cannon.flavor: If the Hades autocannon generates a rain of fire, the vastly enlarged Hades gatling cannon summons forth a hurricane. Firing several hundred rune-graven rounds per second, this weapon churns everything in its sights to unrecognisable pulp.
Hades Gatling Cannon.name: Hades Gatling Cannon

Havoc Launcher.flavor: These launchers fire clusters of highly explosive missiles.
Havoc Launcher.name: Havoc Launcher

Haywire Blaster.flavor: Haywire blasters are long-barrelled weapons that siphon the electromagnetic energy crackling around Commorragh’s highest aeries, to later release it in a terrifyingly powerful burst. A well-aimed haywire blaster can cripple an enemy vehicle’s control systems in a single shot.
Haywire Blaster.name: Haywire Blaster

Haywire Grenade.flavor: Haywire grenades release electromagnetic pulses that damage vehicles.
Haywire Grenade.name: Haywire Grenade

Heat Lance.flavor: The heat lance combines melta and high-yield las technology into a weapon that has both surprising reach and extreme destructive potential.
Heat Lance.name: Heat Lance

Heat Ray Dispersed.flavor: The heat ray is a multipurpose fusion weapon whose focussed blasts can slice an enemy tank in half from end to end. Should the heat ray be turned upon enemy infantry, the operator can instead fire a dispersed beam, bathing his target in clouds of scorching plasma.
Heat Ray Dispersed.name: Heat Ray Dispersed

Heat Ray Focused.flavor: The heat ray is a multipurpose fusion weapon whose focussed blasts can slice an enemy tank in half from end to end. Should the heat ray be turned upon enemy infantry, the operator can instead fire a dispersed beam, bathing his target in clouds of scorching plasma.
Heat Ray Focused.name: Heat Ray Focused

Heavy Arc Rifle.flavor: The Heavy Arc Rifle is a weapon of exceptional power, designed for one purpose: to neutralise armoured vehicles on the battlefield. This archaic weapon utilises an ancient and misunderstood technology to ensure that no enemy tank or war machine can withstand its presence. The weapon's electro-pyromagnetic generator unleashes a massive arc of electrical energy that courses through the armour of enemy vehicles, disrupting their circuits and melting their systems from the inside out.
Heavy Arc Rifle.name: Heavy Arc Rifle

Heavy Bolter.flavor: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.
Heavy Bolter.name: Heavy Bolter

Heavy D-Scythe.flavor: The most dangerous of all Aeldari weapons enable their user to open a portal to the Warp. Often called D-weapons, these technological terrors collapse an area of the material universe. Whether the rift is localised or dispersed, the result is invariably fatal for those nearby.
Heavy D-Scythe.name: Heavy D-Scythe

Heavy Flamer.flavor: Flamers are short-ranged weapons that spew out highly volatile clouds of liquid chemicals that ignite on contact with air. They are primarily used to scour the enemy from defended positions, as walls are of no defence against blasts of superheated vapour.
Heavy Flamer.name: Heavy Flamer

Heavy Gauss Cannon.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.
Heavy Gauss Cannon.name: Heavy Gauss Cannon

Heavy Grav-Cannon.flavor: The graviton technologies used by the Adeptus Mechanicus are fearsome indeed. A target hit by the heavy grav-cannon’s invisible field will be stunned and likely crippled, or even crushed under their own exponentially increased mass until all that is left is an oozing disc of biometallic waste.
Heavy Grav-Cannon.name: Heavy Grav-Cannon

Heavy Laser Destroyer.flavor: The Laser Destroyer is an ancient and complex weapons system produced by very few Forge Worlds, with a reputation for huge range and reliable damage even exceeding that of a Lascannon. In those rare Adeptus Mechanicus sites that still produce them, it is a lengthy process with the components hand-crafted painstakingly. Of course, nothing less would do for Belisarius Cawl and rare Executioner tank designs replace their Macro Plasma Incinerator with a Heavy Laser Destroyer.
Heavy Laser Destroyer.name: Heavy Laser Destroyer

Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon.flavor: Like many rotary machine guns through Terra’s long history, the Onslaught makes up for its lack of armour penetration with an absolute hail of high calibre bullets. Given its relative reliability of fire, the Adeptus Mechanicus have mounted it on many Primaris vehicles, ranging from the light Invader right up to heavier versions on Redemptor Dreadnoughts and Repulsor Executioners.
Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon.name: Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon

Heavy Phosphor Blaster.flavor: Phosphor weapons range from the hand-held serpenta favoured by many Tech-Priests to the heavy phosphor blaster mounted upon Kataphron Battle Servitors. The burning white spheres that shoot out from phosphor weapons cling tenaciously to their targets, sizzling wildly as they melt into flesh or burrow through armour and exoskeleton alike. More often than not, it is these luminagenic orbs that deal the death blow. Even if a target proves tough enough to survive the burning pain, the phosphorescent glow these spheres exude can guide an ally's volley to strike the same target.
Heavy Phosphor Blaster.name: Heavy Phosphor Blaster

Heavy Stubber.flavor: These are low-tech solutions to ranged warfare on high-tech battlefields. Encompassing such weapons as shotguns, stub guns and heavy stubbers (sometimes called sluggers), the common bond between all of these weapons is that they are, without exception, cumbersome, noisy and fairly primitive firearms. Often employed by gangers, law enforcement officers and even civilians across the Imperium, these weapons make a formidable din when fired, and are easy to maintain.
Heavy Stubber.name: Heavy Stubber

Heavy Venom Cannon.flavor: These powerful bio-weapons fire salvoes of corrosive crystals at tremendous velocities which shatter on impact to shred the foe.
Heavy Venom Cannon.name: Heavy Venom Cannon

Hellglaive.flavor: A hellglaive is a lightweight, twin-bladed halberd. Though it requires some effort to master, this weapon can spin and block like a stave, cut like a scythe, or impale like a barbed spear. From the back of a Hellion skyboard such a weapon can prove especially lethal, lopping off heads and severing limbs with every blow.
Hellglaive.name: Hellglaive

Hellmaw Cannon.flavor: The paired Hellmaw cannons slung under the Brass Scorpion’s abdomen gout flames direct from the Warp itself. Once the daemon-riddled Brass Scorpion has cracked open a fortification with its Hellcrusher claws, it likes to use the Hellmaws to flush out the garrison, so it can torment them at leisure.
Hellmaw Cannon.name: Hellmaw Cannon

Hellstrike Missile.flavor: These missiles can tear through heretic armour and xenos flesh alike.
Hellstrike Missile.name: Hellstrike Missile

Honour Blade.flavor: An honour blade is a long, broad-bladed spear that is used to settle disputes between Ethereal caste members in stylised bloodless duels. Against the unenlightened races of the galaxy, it is a deadly weapon used in elegant sweeping movements where the blade becomes virtually invisible.
Honour Blade.name: Honour Blade

Hornet Pulse Laser.flavor: Aeldari lasers use psychically grown crystals to refine the already intense bursts to their optimum potency. Many Aeldari consider the laser weapon the most elegant of all, exulting in the fact that their technological mastery extends even to light itself.
Hornet Pulse Laser.name: Hornet Pulse Laser

Hot-Shot Lasgun.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Hot-Shot Lasgun.name: Hot-Shot Lasgun

Hunter-Killer Missile.flavor: Hunter-killer missiles are commonly fitted to Imperial vehicles. These single-use weapon systems allow vehicles such as Rhinos to engage armoured enemy vehicles that would otherwise far outmatch them.
Hunter-Killer Missile.name: Hunter-Killer Missile

Huskblade.flavor: Leaving smoking trails as it carves through the air, a huskblade instantly evaporates the moisture in anything it touches, reducing targets to shrivelled and gruesome corpses that fall away to dust on the breeze.
Huskblade.name: Huskblade

Hyperphase Threshers.flavor: The Skorpekh strain of the Destroyer Cult hunger for the immediacy of death—and their chosen tool, supplied by the Crypteks, are Hyperphase weapons. These take a variety of forms, akin to swords, glaives and and scythes. They all share the same ability, to vibrate across dimensions and hence pass through enemy defenses with ease.
Hyperphase Threshers.name: Hyperphase Threshers

Icarus Rocket Pod.flavor: Intended as an air defence system, the seven rockets contained in an Icarus Pod are designed to bring any aerial threats crashing to the ground. Though the rockets are small, their guidance systems make them extremely effective against flying targets.
Icarus Rocket Pod.name: Icarus Rocket Pod

Impaler Cannon.flavor: Impaler cannons propel osseous spines at such high velocities that they can punch through reinforced plasteel. At the base of each spine is a small creature known as a shard-beast that uses thin membranous fins to steer the spine towards its target.
Impaler Cannon.name: Impaler Cannon

Ironhail Heavy Stubber.flavor: These are low-tech solutions to ranged warfare on high-tech battlefields. Encompassing such weapons as shotguns, stub guns and heavy stubbers (sometimes called sluggers), the common bond between all of these weapons is that they are, without exception, cumbersome, noisy and fairly primitive firearms. Often employed by gangers, law enforcement officers and even civilians across the Imperium, these weapons make a formidable din when fired, and are easy to maintain.
Ironhail Heavy Stubber.name: Ironhail Heavy Stubber

Implosion Missile.flavor: Upon detonation, these missiles emit a molecular dissonance field that causes those caught in their path to implode, instantly collapsing in upon themselves and leaving nothing more than a scorched silhouette to mark their passage.
Implosion Missile.name: Implosion Missile

Incendine Combustor.flavor: Typically mounted atop the Kastelan Battle Robot, the incendine combustor hurls out great gouts of burning, thrice-blessed promethium. Laced with Magos-blessed unguents and ignited by a flame lit from the Perpetual Forge, each holy fire-thrower can turn a technoheretic into foul tallow in a matter of seconds.
Incendine Combustor.name: Incendine Combustor

Ion Accelerator (Overcharged).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Ion Accelerator (Overcharged).name: Ion Accelerator (Overcharged)

Ion Accelerator (Standard).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Ion Accelerator (Standard).name: Ion Accelerator (Standard)

Ion Rifle (Overcharged).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Ion Rifle (Overcharged).name: Ion Rifle (Overcharged)

Ion Rifle (Standard).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Ion Rifle (Standard).name: Ion Rifle (Standard)

Jokaero Digital Weapon.description: Item that deals damage to the target enemy unit.
Jokaero Digital Weapon.flavor: Miniaturized killing tools of remarkable power, commonly concealed within jewellery, and created by a race of primate-like xenos with an apparently instinctive understanding of technology. The Imperium has, as yet, been unable to replicate the construction of these digi-weapons.
Jokaero Digital Weapon.name: Jokaero Digital Weapon

Kan Klaw.flavor: Orks favour brutal power klaws over the more sophisticated power fists of other races. These huge hydraulic shears are capable of rending and crushing even the toughest foes. Ork walkers are fitted with klaws that befit their greater size, and can rip through anything foolish enough to stand in the pilot's way.
Kan Klaw.name: Kan Klaw

Klaive.flavor: Klaives are massive ritual powerblades of brutal aspect. Shimmering with dark energy, these weapons are impossibly light for their size and can slice through the thickest armour and toughest flesh with insulting ease.
Klaive.name: Klaive

Klaw of Gork.flavor: Orks favour brutal power klaws over the more sophisticated power fists of other races. These huge hydraulic shears are capable of rending and crushing even the toughest foes. Ork walkers are fitted with klaws that befit their greater size, and can rip through anything foolish enough to stand in the pilot's way.
Klaw of Gork.name: Klaw of Gork

Krak Grenade.flavor: Krak grenades are implosive charges designed to crack vehicle armour.
Krak Grenade.name: Krak Grenade

Krak Missile Launcher.flavor: Missile launchers can fire a variety of different missiles, making them incredibly versatile weapons.
Krak Missile Launcher.name: Krak Missile Launcher

Krakstorm Missile Silo.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.
Krakstorm Missile Silo.name: Krakstorm Missile Silo

Kroot Gun.flavor: Kroot use primitive slug-throwers adapted by the T'au to fire pulse rounds.
Kroot Gun.name: Kroot Gun

Kustom Mega-Blasta.flavor: A Mek's favourite gun often becomes his pet project, tinkered with until it boasts a profusion of worky gubbinz and zappy bits. On a good day, even the most portable of such guns can melt a hole through a Space Marine at twenty paces. The power of kustom mega-weapons comes at a price, of course, and an overheated weapon is likely to blow up. Yet the spectacular damage these weapons can cause is considered to more than make up the risk.
Kustom Mega-Blasta.name: Kustom Mega-Blasta

Kustom Mega-Slugga.flavor: A Mek's favourite gun often becomes his pet project, tinkered with until it boasts a profusion of worky gubbinz and zappy bits. On a good day, even the most portable of such guns can melt a hole through a Space Marine at twenty paces. The power of kustom mega-weapons comes at a price, of course, and an overheated weapon is likely to blow up. Yet the spectacular damage these weapons can cause is considered to more than make up the risk.
Kustom Mega-Slugga.name: Kustom Mega-Slugga

Lascannon.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Lascannon.name: Lascannon

Laser Lance (Melee).flavor: Used by the Shining Spears Aspect Warriors, laser lances produce built-up pulses of energy that are released with explosive force when the wielder charges the target.
Laser Lance (Melee).name: Laser Lance (Melee)

Laser Lance (Ranged).flavor: Used by the Shining Spears Aspect Warriors, laser lances produce built-up pulses of energy that are released with explosive force when the wielder charges the target.
Laser Lance (Ranged).name: Laser Lance (Ranged)

Lasgun.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Lasgun.name: Lasgun

Lasgun Array.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Lasgun Array.name: Lasgun Array

Lash Whip and Bonesword.flavor: Some Tyranid creatures wield these bio-weapons as a deadly symbiotic combination.
Lash Whip and Bonesword.name: Lash Whip and Bonesword

Lash Whips.flavor: Lash whips are cords of muscle that move at lightning speeds to slash their prey.
Lash Whips.name: Lash Whips

Lashing Warp Energies.flavor: If it’s loathsome aura wasn’t enough warning, the nearer you get to the Noctilith Crown, the more it’s unholy energies pull at you, shredding the strongest defences, or even pulling weaker assailants wholesale into the warp.
Lashing Warp Energies.name: Lashing Warp Energies

Laspistol.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Laspistol.name: Laspistol

Life Leech.flavor: With a twist of his gnarled hands, the wrathful psyker rips the life force from his enemy, hoarding the stolen essence and using it to restore the injured flesh of his allies.
Life Leech.name: Life Leech

Lightning Claws.flavor: Lightning claws are commonly used as matched pairs and consist of a number of blades, each a miniature power weapon, normally mounted on the back of the hand.
Lightning Claws.name: Lightning Claws

Litany of the Electromancer.flavor: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.
Litany of the Electromancer.name: Litany of the Electromancer

Macro Plasma Incinerator (Standard).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Macro Plasma Incinerator (Standard).name: Macro Plasma Incinerator (Standard)

Macro Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Macro Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged).name: Macro Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged)

Mandiblasters.flavor: Mandiblasters spit needle shards that channel a deadly laser blast.
Mandiblasters.name: Mandiblasters

Melta Bomb.description: Usable against vehicles, monstrous creatures or fortifications.
Melta Bomb.flavor: Melta bombs are fusion charges designed to burn through an armoured hull in a matter of seconds.
Melta Bomb.name: Melta Bomb

Melta Cannon.flavor: This weapon swiftly reduces armoured targets to molten slag.
Melta Cannon.name: Melta Cannon

Meltagun.flavor: Melta weapons are lethal anti-armour guns, most effective at very short range. When fired, the super-heating of the air produces a distinctive and sinister hiss. Solid rock is reduced to molten slag, and living creatures are vaporised in an instant!
Meltagun.name: Meltagun

Meteoric Descent.flavor: These winged terrors hurtle out of the storm-wracked skies, tearing their unsuspecting prey to pieces in a single, devastating swoop.
Meteoric Descent.name: Meteoric Descent

Missile Pod.flavor: A simple but effective delivery system for multiple missiles, these weapon pods are used on light vehicles and heavy infantry at medium range, and are mounted on many battlesuits and drones.
Missile Pod.name: Missile Pod

Molten Beam.flavor: The pyromancer claps his hands together and turns them outward towards the foe. As he does so, a white-hot beam of blazing energy bursts from his palms. It melts armour to slag and vaporises flesh, leaving only ghastly shadows in its wake.
Molten Beam.name: Molten Beam

Multi-Laser.flavor: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.
Multi-Laser.name: Multi-Laser

Multi-Melta.flavor: Melta weapons are lethal anti-armour guns, most effective at very short range. When fired, the super-heating of the air produces a distinctive and sinister hiss. Solid rock is reduced to molten slag, and living creatures are vaporised in an instant!
Multi-Melta.name: Multi-Melta

Neutron Blaster.flavor: Stingwing weapons are a hybrid of Vespid and T'au technology. The crystal mounted upon each blaster emits a powerful neutron blast that is able to bypass all but the most effective armour.
Neutron Blaster.name: Neutron Blaster

Nose Drill.flavor: Though the Flyboy was doubtless furious to see his treasured Dakkajet confined to Gladius Prime’s surface, the Meks can present one positive—the ability to put a giant drill in the empty nosecone, enabling the Scrapjet to cut through enemies the way it used to cut through the air.
Nose Drill.name: Nose Drill

Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.flavor: The experimental Nova Reactors are only used on a handful of Battlesuit designs. Damage cannot be avoided from their use, but sometimes they must be employed for the Greater Good to supercharge offensive or defensive weapon systems—or, as here, to render the Battlesuit’s local area utterly lethal with a burst of raw power.
Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave.name: Nova Electromagnetic Shockwave

Onslaught Gatling Cannon.flavor: Like many rotary machine guns through Terra’s long history, the Onslaught makes up for its lack of armour penetration with an absolute hail of high calibre bullets. Given its relative reliability of fire, the Adeptus Mechanicus have mounted it on many Primaris vehicles, ranging from the light Invader right up to heavier versions on Redemptor Dreadnoughts and Repulsor Executioners.
Onslaught Gatling Cannon.name: Onslaught Gatling Cannon

Oppressor Cannon.flavor: The Rogal Dorn tank’s signature weapon is quite capable of taking down a distant enemy Knight in a single salvo, with the impact of an entire squadron of Vindicators.
Oppressor Cannon.name: Oppressor Cannon

Paragon Grenade Launcher.flavor: The twin grenade launchers embedded in this model of Paragon Warsuit are designed to be fired on the move, spreading an array of larger fragmentation shells across a wide area.
Paragon Grenade Launcher.name: Paragon Grenade Launcher

Paragon War Blade.flavor: Commonly equipped with one of the holy trinity of Adepta Sororitas heavy weapons – the heavy bolter, Ministorum heavy flamer, and multi-melta – Paragon Warsuits also wield huge melee weapons crackling with power fields to tear through enemy armour like it was tissue paper.
Paragon War Blade.name: Paragon War Blade

Particle Whip.flavor: These weapons emit a stream of minuscule antimatter particles that detonate upon contact with their target. They are incredibly reliable, needing only enough energy to maintain the containment field that prevents the anti-matter from detonating within the weapon's own firing mechanism.
Particle Whip.name: Particle Whip

Penitent Buzz-Blade.flavor: The machines’ arm-mounted flamers blaze a trail of fiery destruction as they thunder towards their foes, and their gigantic, razor-edged buzz saws carve through armour, flesh and bone with every frenzied swipe.
Penitent Buzz-Blade.name: Penitent Buzz-Blade

Phosphor Blaster.flavor: Phosphor weapons range from the hand-held serpenta favoured by many Tech-Priests to the heavy phosphor blaster mounted upon Kataphron Battle Servitors. The burning white spheres that shoot out from phosphor weapons cling tenaciously to their targets, sizzling wildly as they melt into flesh or burrow through armour and exoskeleton alike. More often than not, it is these luminagenic orbs that deal the death blow. Even if a target proves tough enough to survive the burning pain, the phosphorescent glow these spheres exude can guide an ally's volley to strike the same target.
Phosphor Blaster.name: Phosphor Blaster

Phosphor Pistol.flavor: Phosphor weapons range from the hand-held serpenta favoured by many Tech-Priests to the heavy phosphor blaster mounted upon Kataphron Battle Servitors. The burning white spheres that shoot out from phosphor weapons cling tenaciously to their targets, sizzling wildly as they melt into flesh or burrow through armour and exoskeleton alike. More often than not, it is these luminagenic orbs that deal the death blow. Even if a target proves tough enough to survive the burning pain, the phosphorescent glow these spheres exude can guide an ally's volley to strike the same target.
Phosphor Pistol.name: Phosphor Pistol

Phosphor Serpenta.flavor: Phosphor weapons range from the hand-held serpenta favoured by many Tech-Priests to the heavy phosphor blaster mounted upon Kataphron Battle Servitors. The burning white spheres that shoot out from phosphor weapons cling tenaciously to their targets, sizzling wildly as they melt into flesh or burrow through armour and exoskeleton alike. More often than not, it is these luminagenic orbs that deal the death blow. Even if a target proves tough enough to survive the burning pain, the phosphorescent glow these spheres exude can guide an ally's volley to strike the same target.
Phosphor Serpenta.name: Phosphor Serpenta

Phosphor Torch.flavor: Flamers are short-ranged weapons that spew out highly volatile clouds of liquid chemicals that ignite on contact with air. They are primarily used to scour the enemy from defended positions, as walls are of no defence against blasts of superheated vapour.
Phosphor Torch.name: Phosphor Torch

Photon Grenade.flavor: Defensive grenades, such as the photon grenades of the T'au, which emit multi-spectrum light and a sonic burst, have dual uses. When being charged, these are thrown to disorient the enemy attack; against shooting, they’re hurled to throw up clouds of concealing gas or smoke.
Photon Grenade.name: Photon Grenade

Plasma Cutter.flavor: Plasma weapons fire pulses of searing energy that are extremely effective against heavy infantry and light vehicles. However, they generate enormous temperatures when fired and are thus prone to overheating—sometimes proving deadly to the firer.
Plasma Cutter.name: Plasma Cutter

Plasma Exterminator (Standard).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Plasma Exterminator (Standard).name: Plasma Exterminator (Standard)

Plasma Exterminator (Supercharged).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Plasma Exterminator (Supercharged).name: Plasma Exterminator (Supercharged)

Plasma Incinerator (Standard).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Plasma Incinerator (Standard).name: Plasma Incinerator (Standard)

Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged).flavor: Cawl’s ten millennia of tinkering produced many surprising results. Even the unstable plasma weaponry commonplace to many races didn’t escape his cogitator’s attention. His Mark III Belisarius Pattern Plasma Incinerators are a marked improvement on previous Imperial versions, harnessing the raw power of stellar fusion to melt enemy armour. This Primaris-only technology is deployed at every scale, from the pistol-sized Exterminators to the Dreadnought-sized Macro Plasma Incinerators.
Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged).name: Plasma Incinerator (Supercharged)

Plasma Grenade.flavor: Plasma grenades are a highly advanced type of assault grenade, commonly employed by the Aeldari.
Plasma Grenade.name: Plasma Grenade

Plasma Pistol.flavor: Plasma weapons fire pulses of searing energy that are extremely effective against heavy infantry and light vehicles. However, they generate enormous temperatures when fired and are thus prone to overheating—sometimes proving deadly to the firer.
Plasma Pistol.name: Plasma Pistol

Plasma Rifle.flavor: Plasma technology is used by many races, despite its highly unstable nature. The T'au favour a form of the technology that forgoes a degree of stopping power for an increased level of safety for the operator.
Plasma Rifle.name: Plasma Rifle

Power Axe.flavor: A power weapon is sheathed in the lethal haze of a disruptive energy field that eats through armour, flesh and bone with ease.
Power Axe.name: Power Axe

Power Fist.flavor: A power weapon is sheathed in the lethal haze of a disruptive energy field that eats through armour, flesh and bone with ease.
Power Fist.name: Power Fist

Power Klaw.flavor: Orks favour brutal power klaws over the more sophisticated power fists of other races. These huge hydraulic shears are capable of rending and crushing even the toughest foes. Ork walkers are fitted with klaws that befit their greater size, and can rip through anything foolish enough to stand in the pilot's way.
Power Klaw.name: Power Klaw

Power Maul.flavor: A power weapon is sheathed in the lethal haze of a disruptive energy field that eats through armour, flesh and bone with ease.
Power Maul.name: Power Maul

Power Scourge.flavor: A power weapon is sheathed in the lethal haze of a disruptive energy field that eats through armour, flesh and bone with ease.
Power Scourge.name: Power Scourge

Power Sword.flavor: A power weapon is sheathed in the lethal haze of a disruptive energy field that eats through armour, flesh and bone with ease.
Power Sword.name: Power Sword

Pulse Bomb.flavor: Pulse technology is common within the Fire caste, and all pulse weapons utilise pulsed induction fields to propel lethal bursts of plasma over great distances. A pulse rifle or carbine is standard issue for Fire Warriors, while Breacher Teams wield pulse blasters, that utilise negatively-charged ion A.R.C. technology to hammer their targets with short ranged bursts of devastating fire. The larger pulse weapons at the T'au's disposal, including the pulse driver cannon and blastcannon, employ superheated plasma on a different scale altogether, leaving only glowing craters to mark where the victims once stood.
Pulse Bomb.name: Pulse Bomb

Pulse Blaster.flavor: Pulse technology is common within the Fire caste, and all pulse weapons utilise pulsed induction fields to propel lethal bursts of plasma over great distances. A pulse rifle or carbine is standard issue for Fire Warriors, while Breacher Teams wield pulse blasters, that utilise negatively-charged ion A.R.C. technology to hammer their targets with short ranged bursts of devastating fire. The larger pulse weapons at the T'au's disposal, including the pulse driver cannon and blastcannon, employ superheated plasma on a different scale altogether, leaving only glowing craters to mark where the victims once stood.
Pulse Blaster.name: Pulse Blaster

Pulse Disintegrator.flavor: The Tantalus’ unique heavy armament employs an unstable form of ‘Darklight’ dark matter, harnessed from the ‘Ilmaea’—black suns stolen from Realspace. A single shot from a Disintegrator can atomise the most heavily armoured opponent—and the Pulse Disintegrator fires a lethal salvo of these, whilst remaining pleasantly cool to the touch.
Pulse Disintegrator.name: Pulse Disintegrator

Pulse Driver Cannon.flavor: Pulse technology is common within the Fire caste, and all pulse weapons utilise pulsed induction fields to propel lethal bursts of plasma over great distances. A pulse rifle or carbine is standard issue for Fire Warriors, while Breacher Teams wield pulse blasters, that utilise negatively-charged ion A.R.C. technology to hammer their targets with short ranged bursts of devastating fire. The larger pulse weapons at the T'au's disposal, including the pulse driver cannon and blastcannon, employ superheated plasma on a different scale altogether, leaving only glowing craters to mark where the victims once stood.
Pulse Driver Cannon.name: Pulse Driver Cannon

Pulse Laser.flavor: Aeldari lasers use psychically grown crystals to refine the already intense bursts to their optimum potency. Many Aeldari consider the laser weapon the most elegant of all, exulting in the fact that their technological mastery extends even to light itself.
Pulse Laser.name: Pulse Laser

Pulse Rifle.flavor: Pulse technology is common within the Fire caste, and all pulse weapons utilise pulsed induction fields to propel lethal bursts of plasma over great distances. A pulse rifle or carbine is standard issue for Fire Warriors, while Breacher Teams wield pulse blasters, that utilise negatively-charged ion A.R.C. technology to hammer their targets with short ranged bursts of devastating fire. The larger pulse weapons at the T'au's disposal, including the pulse driver cannon and blastcannon, employ superheated plasma on a different scale altogether, leaving only glowing craters to mark where the victims once stood.
Pulse Rifle.name: Pulse Rifle

Pulse Submunitions Cannon.flavor: Pulse technology is common within the Fire caste, and all pulse weapons utilise pulsed induction fields to propel lethal bursts of plasma over great distances. A pulse rifle or carbine is standard issue for Fire Warriors, while Breacher Teams wield pulse blasters, that utilise negatively-charged ion A.R.C. technology to hammer their targets with short ranged bursts of devastating fire. The larger pulse weapons at the T'au's disposal, including the pulse driver cannon and blastcannon, employ superheated plasma on a different scale altogether, leaving only glowing craters to mark where the victims once stood.
Pulse Submunitions Cannon.name: Pulse Submunitions Cannon

Prehensile Pincer.flavor: The tails of some Tyranids are deadly weapons, from bony protrusions dense enough to cave in the side of a tank to stingers containing enough poison to kill whole regiments.
Prehensile Pincer.name: Prehensile Pincer

Prism Cannon (Dispersed).flavor: Typically mounted on Fire Prisms, prism cannons greatly amplify the power of a high-intensity laser through priceless psychocrystal to generate a devastating blast. This can be focussed into a narrow beam or widened to destroy a broader area at will.
Prism Cannon (Dispersed).name: Prism Cannon (Dispersed)

Prism Cannon (Focused).flavor: Typically mounted on Fire Prisms, prism cannons greatly amplify the power of a high-intensity laser through priceless psychocrystal to generate a devastating blast. This can be focussed into a narrow beam or widened to destroy a broader area at will.
Prism Cannon (Focused).name: Prism Cannon (Focused)

Prism Cannon (Lance).flavor: Typically mounted on Fire Prisms, prism cannons greatly amplify the power of a high-intensity laser through priceless psychocrystal to generate a devastating blast. This can be focussed into a narrow beam or widened to destroy a broader area at will.
Prism Cannon (Lance).name: Prism Cannon (Lance)

Psychic Maelstrom.flavor: The telekine focuses his entire mental might into creating a vast maelstrom of destructive power, unleashing a storm of psychic energies that utterly consume his foes.
Psychic Maelstrom.name: Psychic Maelstrom

Psychic Overload.flavor: The psyker plunges tendrils of psychic energy into the target’s brain, causing it to explode!
Psychic Overload.name: Psychic Overload

Psychic Scream.flavor: Through its vassal, the Hive Mind unleashes a piercing shriek of undiluted psychic energy that shreds the minds of those caught in the wake.
Psychic Scream.name: Psychic Scream

Pteraxii Talons.flavor: Warriors across the galaxy employ a wide variety of close-quarter weapons. Blood-flecked chainswords and crude knives take their places alongside powered weapons of all kinds: swords, axes, hammers and many more. All such weapons are designed to bring quick and painful death to the foe, for every moment's delay brings defeat a step closer.
Pteraxii Talons.name: Pteraxii Talons

Quad Ion Turret (Overcharged).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Quad Ion Turret (Overcharged).name: Quad Ion Turret (Overcharged)

Quad Ion Turret (Standard).flavor: The high-energy streams fired by ion weapons react destructively with their target, vaporising flesh and metal with equal ease. Ion weapons can be overcharged to generate a more devastating attack, but at a risk of overheating its primary power cells.
Quad Ion Turret (Standard).name: Quad Ion Turret (Standard)

Rad-Saturation.flavor: Harnessing the destructive energies of forge worlds within their weaponry, certain Skitarii are so soaked in radiation that even to approach them is to confer a death sentence upon yourself. Victory for them is pyrrhic, as this radiation burns through even their heavy armour plate, slowly poisoning them to death even as their carbines bring about the (much quicker) demise of their enemies.
Rad-Saturation.name: Rad-Saturation

Radium Carbine.flavor: Radium weapons are so volatile that they eventually kill their wielders. Their baroque beauty belies a singularly vile function – not only to strike, but to render the battlefield as deadly as the rad-wastes of Mars. Each weapon’s bullet cylinder is so thoroughly bathed in radium that a volley can cause a localised rad-storm. Those inside soon find their flesh blackening and sloughing away.
Radium Carbine.name: Radium Carbine

Radium Serpenta.flavor: Radium weapons are so volatile that they eventually kill their wielders. Their baroque beauty belies a singularly vile function – not only to strike, but to render the battlefield as deadly as the rad-wastes of Mars. Each weapon’s bullet cylinder is so thoroughly bathed in radium that a volley can cause a localised rad-storm. Those inside soon find their flesh blackening and sloughing away.
Radium Serpenta.name: Radium Serpenta

Railgun with Solid Shot.flavor: T'au rail weapons use linear accelerator technology to fire a solid projectile at hyper-velocity. They are capable of punching through the thickest of armour and of taking down the largest of enemies.
Railgun with Solid Shot.name: Railgun with Solid Shot

Ranger Long Rifle.flavor: Ranger long rifles are precision implements, accurate enough to pick out weak points in a target’s armour even at extreme distances.
Ranger Long Rifle.name: Ranger Long Rifle

Rapid-fire Battle Cannon.flavor: This long range cannon is the equivalent of a large calibre artillery piece affixed to the arm of an Imperial Knight. Its rapid self-loading allows for accurate fire to be poured out at a tremendous rate and the blast of its explosive shot can rack up horrific casualties. It is often employed against infantry hordes, medium tanks and squadrons of light vehicles.
Rapid-fire Battle Cannon.name: Rapid-fire Battle Cannon

Razorflail.flavor: Razorflails are wielded as a twinned pair of blades that at first glance resemble long, flimsy and unwieldy swords. Yet with a single flick of the wrist each can split apart and lash out like a whip, their whistling blades almost impossible to block or parry.
Razorflail.name: Razorflail

Reaper Autocannon.flavor: There is a particular type of double-barrelled autocannon called the Reaper, which is no longer employed by the forces of the Emperor. It is mostly used by Chaos Terminators, allowing them to lay down a withering hail of shots, which gives them a much greater chance of hitting those unfortunate enough to be in their crosshairs.
Reaper Autocannon.name: Reaper Autocannon

Reaper Launcher (Starshot Missile).flavor: Used to deadly effect by Dark Reaper Aspect Warriors, reaper launchers fire a fusillade of armour-piercing starswarm missiles. Some Dark Reapers also make use of the more powerful starshot missiles, which have a lower rate of fire, but allow them to engage enemy tanks and fortifications with impunity.
Reaper Launcher (Starshot Missile).name: Reaper Launcher (Starshot Missile)

Reaper Launcher (Starswarm Missile).flavor: Used to deadly effect by Dark Reaper Aspect Warriors, reaper launchers fire a fusillade of armour-piercing starswarm missiles. Some Dark Reapers also make use of the more powerful starshot missiles, which have a lower rate of fire, but allow them to engage enemy tanks and fortifications with impunity.
Reaper Launcher (Starswarm Missile).name: Reaper Launcher (Starswarm Missile)

Rending Claws.flavor: The diamond-hard tips of these claws can tear through armour.
Rending Claws.name: Rending Claws

Rod of Covenant (Melee).flavor: The rod of covenant is a tool of swift execution for those found wanting by the Triarch Praetorians. Within the head of each weapon is caged a roiling fragment of a dying star bound within a potent force field, capable of burning through a foe's armour as if it were dry parchment.
